means: 宗派，教派( sect的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: Members of these sects are ruthlessly persecuted and suppressed.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些教派的成员遭到了残酷的迫害和镇压.

sentence.Network_en: By the first century BC, Buddhism was in danger of fragmenting into small sects.
sentence.Network_cn: 到公元前1世纪时，佛教面临着被分化成一些小派别的危险。

sentence.Network_en: He had subdued the religious sects, cleaned up Saigon.
sentence.Network_cn: 他压服了宗教派别, 刷新了西贡的面貌.

entry.def: A sect is a group of people that has separated from a larger group and has a particular set of religious or political beliefs.

auth_sentence.content: For the most part, these sects were tolerated.
